Dear Ms. Hill:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
September 25, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
R 326 (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency, the borrowing agency
shall have a record containing all the following.
(b) Verification that the foster parent is willing to
accept the foster child.
One borrowed home file was reviewed. The file did not contain documentation that
the foster parent is willing to accept the foster child.
Repeat Violation Established:
09/08/2022 Renewal, CAP Approved 09/27/2022
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
R 326 (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency, the borrowing agency
shall have a record containing all the following.
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
One borrowed home file was reviewed. The file did not contain documentation that
the foster parent had received orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
2

Repeat Violation Established:
09/08/2022 Renewal, CAP Approved 09/27/2022
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
R 326 (1) Before placing a child in a foster home
certified by another agency, the borrowing agency
shall have a record containing all the following.
(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement
signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
One borrowed home file was reviewed. The file did not contain a copy of the foster
parent /agency agreement signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact.
(2) An agency social service worker shall visit the
foster child, and the foster parent, if applicable, in the

FOM 722-08D Treatment plans.
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must obtain
signatures from the following individuals, as applicable:
• Caseworker. • Supervisor. • Second line supervisor, when

FOM 801-03 Medical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport must
be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the
child's current and complete health information.
Four foster care files were reviewed. Two of four files each contained a medical
passport that was not updated.
Repeat Violation Established:
09/08/2022 Renewal, CAP Approved 09/227/2022.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting. In two files the complete DHS-1105 was
not uploaded. The document had been completed but only partially uploaded.
 R 400.12312 Foster Parent Training. In one home file it was not clear if both
parents had received the same six-hour training. Documentation specifying that
each parent received the training should be in the file.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted a corrective action plan on September 27, 2022, in response to
violations established during the renewal inspection completed on September 8,
2022. There were four repeat violations established during the current Interim
Inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was submitted and reviewed. The
assessment was thorough and well written. The effectiveness of the agency CAP
submitted on September 27, 2022, in response to violations established during the
renewal inspection, were detailed in the assessment. The assessment also noted
4

that the agency has had difficulty filling vacant positions which results in increased
caseloads for staff and supervisors.
Financial Overview
The agency budget was submitted and reviewed and indicates that the agency is
fiscally viable. A certified public audit dated December 31, 2022 was submitted
and reviewed.
Staff Interviews
Staff reported that they feel supported by their respective supervisors and the
agency administration. Staff further reported that they are part of a strong
supportive team dedicated to helping children and families.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is a modern, spacious, organized, and well-maintained facility. CHRI
documents were secured properly.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified one safety alert during her visits to the home's. The
safety alert is as follows:
Safety Alert #1. A safety alert was generated on June 23, 2023, as a foster home
was found to not have a carbon monoxide detector.
Resolution: The agency purchased a detector for the family and it was installed on
June 23, 2023. Photos of the installed detector were provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
